code:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
if (a * b) % 2 == 0:
    print("Even")
else:
    print("Odd")


This Python code reads two integers a and b from the standard input, calculates their product, and checks if the product is even or odd by checking if the remainder of the division by 2 is 0. It then prints "Even" or "Odd" accordingly.

The input() function reads a line from the standard input, split() function splits this line into words, map() function applies the int() function to all words and list() function converts the result to a list of integers. The result is assigned to the variables a and b.

The if statement checks if the remainder of the division of a and b is zero. If it is, it prints "Even". If it is not, it prints "Odd".

The % operator is the modulus operator, which returns the remainder of the division.


'''

# It takes two integers as input from the user and then calculates their product.
# If the product is divisible by 2 (i.e., the remainder is 0), it prints "Even".
# If the product is not divisible by 2 (i.e., the remainder is not 0), it prints "Odd".
# The code uses the modulus operator (%) to calculate

a, b = map(int, input().split())
if (a * b) % 2 == 0:
    print("Even")
else:
    print("Odd")
